text: Tim Boss (born 28 June 1993) is a German footballer who plays as goalkeeper for SV Wehen Wiesbaden. ==Career== In his youth, Boss played for Bayer Leverkusen and Wuppertaler SV. In the 2012–13 season he transferred to the second team Fortuna Düsseldorf, playing in the Regionalliga West. In the summer of 2014 he moved to league rivals SG Wattenscheid 09. He played in all 34 matches of the 2014–15 season. After just one season, in July 2015, he moved to 3. Liga side Fortuna Köln. There he made his debut on 28 August 2015 during the 2–1 home win over 1. FC Magdeburg on matchday 6 when he came on as a substitute in the 83rd minute for André Poggenborg. On 18 June 2018, Dynamo Dresden announced they had signed Boss on a two-year contract, valid for the three upper classes of the German football league system. He left Dresden in 2020 for Wehen Wiesbaden. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Living people Category:1993 births Category:Sportspeople from Cologne Category:German footballers Category:Association football goalkeepers Category:Fortuna Düsseldorf II players Category:SG Wattenscheid 09 players Category:SC Fortuna Köln players Category:Dynamo Dresden players Category:SV Wehen Wiesbaden players Category:Regionalliga players Category:3. title: Tim Boss
